note.p: Death: Pegwell Cottage, near Ramsgate, Kent (24 September 1840)

Career: Articled to an attorney, Milk Street, Cheapside; admitted to Lincoln's Inn (1778); called to the Bar (1783); KC (1793); MP for Gatton (1805-1806); MP for Callington (1806-1807); MP for Eye (1812-1817); Solicitor General (1812); Attorney General (1813); Baron of the Exchequer (1817-1832); retired (1832); Privy Councillor (1832)
